embed: <object width="425" height="344"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/Wk8zAr0R9zQ&hl=en&fs=1"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/Wk8zAr0R9zQ&hl=en&fs=1" allowscriptaccess="always" height="344" width="425" allowfullscreen="true" type="application/x-shockwave-flash"></embed></object>
summary:
Many of you are probably familiar with NLTK, the wonderful Natural Language
Toolkit for Python. You may not be familiar with Linkgrammar, which is a
sentence parsing system created at Carnegie Melon university. Linkgrammar is
quite robust and works "out of the box" in a way that NLTK does not for
sentence parsing.
title: Parsing sentences with the OTHER natural language tool: LinkGrammar
